metadata.title: CVE-2021-20196 QEMU: block: fdc: null pointer dereference may lead to guest crash (low)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the floppy disk emulator of QEMU. This issue occurs while processing read/write ioport commands if the selected floppy drive is not initialized with a block device. This flaw allows a privileged guest user to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. 
            STATEMENT: This issue affects the version of the qemu-kvm package shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7 and 8. Future qemu-kvm package updates for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and 8 may address this issue.

This has been rated as having Low security impact and is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 & 6. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

criterions.comment: qemu-img-rhev is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
qemu-kvm-rhev is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
qemu-kvm-common-rhev is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
qemu-kvm-tools-rhev is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
